intro: Synmeria schizochilus, commonly known as the rock fig, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, round fig-like structure that ripens to a yellowish color. Synmeria schizochilus is often found growing on rocky substrates and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
